sentences.english: During the night, somebody had cut the boat loose from its moorings.
sentences.chinese: 有人在夜間砍斷了泊船的纜繩。

sentences.english: All the cargo derrick wires and mooring ropes were also missing.
sentences.chinese: 所有吊機用的鋼繩以及靠泊用的纜繩亦均遺失。

sentences.english: Then he untied the painter and took the sculls again.
sentences.chinese: 然後他解開纜繩，拿起雙槳。

sentences.english: We disentangled the ropes and heaved them on the ship.
sentences.chinese: 我們解開纜繩上的結，把纜繩絞上船。

sentences.english: We disentangled the ropes and heaved them on the ship.
sentences.chinese: 我們解開纜繩上的結，把纜繩絞上船。

sentences.english: Their fishing boats were cabled together before the storm came.
sentences.chinese: 暴風雨降臨前，他們的漁船都用纜繩系在一起。

sentences.english: The seamen knew where each rope belayed on deck.
sentences.chinese: 水手們知道每根纜繩可拴在甲板上什麼地方。

sentences.english: How to arrange the mooring line?
The hawser can either be thick, heavy ropes.
sentences.chinese: 纜繩既可以指粗重的繩子。

sentences.english: I jumped up , pushed the boat under the water with my feet , and caught one of the ship's ropes .
sentences.chinese: 我縱身一跳，把小船踩入水中，抓住大船的一根纜繩。

sentences.english: Ease off that rope a bit.
After much tugging, the rope untangled itself and straightened out.
sentences.chinese: 拉了好久才把纜繩解開弄直。

sentences.english: He resolutely hacked off the cable and the sail slipped down.
sentences.chinese: 他果斷地砍斷了纜繩，主帆滑落了下來。

sentences.english: First they unlocked the rover wheels, thendisconnected the cable to the lander.
sentences.chinese: 首先他們解鎖月球車的車輪，接着斷開着陸器纜繩。

definition: to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
variant of 漁網|渔网[yu2 wang3]
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
